definition: pitch-black/(fig.) to be completely in the dark
one/1/single/a (article)/as soon as/entire/whole/all/throughout/"one" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 1)/also pr. [yao1] for greater clarity when spelling out numbers digit by digit
round/lump/ball/to roll into a ball/to gather/regiment/group/society/classifier for a lump or a soft mass: wad (of paper), ball (of wool), cloud (of smoke)
abbr. for Heilongjiang province 黑龍江|黑龙江[Hei1 long2 jiang1]

sentences.english: The universe was like a big black egg, carrying Pan Gu inside itself.
sentences.chinese: 宇宙像是一個大雞蛋，裏面一團漆黑。

sentences.english: I could not even see things near my feet clearly if I turned off the lamp.
sentences.chinese: 四周一團漆黑，熄掉電筒，連腳下都不易看清。

sentences.english: It was the Egyptian darkness that stopped him from marching on.
sentences.chinese: 就是一團漆黑阻止了他繼續前進。

sentences.english: There was the grinding of brakes—and then darkness.
sentences.chinese: 剎車發出了刺耳的聲音，接着便是一團漆黑。

sentences.english: Outside it was pitch dark and it was raining cats and dogs.
sentences.chinese: 外面一團漆黑，大雨傾盆。

sentences.english: In the inky blackness she could find no way around it.
sentences.chinese: 周圍一團漆黑，她找不到一條道路。
